newsitem.title: FRANCE: Air France, Royal Air Maroc strengthen ties.
newsitem.headline: Air France, Royal Air Maroc strengthen ties.

text.p: French state-owned airline Air France announced on Tuesday it had signed an agreement with Royal Air Maroc to increase cooperation between the two carriers.
"The main aim of this agreement is to develop new services and promote air traffic as much between Morocco and France as between their hubs," Air France said in a statement.

Air France said the deal provided for closer flight programme coordination and gradual implementation of so-called code sharing between the two carriers. Code sharing allows one airline to issue a through ticket using a connecting flight on its partner's network, helping save costs and increase traffic.
The code sharing would cover flights this winter between Casablanca and Lyon and Casablanca and Strasbourg.
Air France holds 3.97 percent of the capital of Royal Air Maroc.
The two airlines will also explore cooperation in such areas as maintenance, stopover assistance, purchasing and freight.
